text: one of Britain's most unusual polling
stations a double-decker bus in Essex
it's been booked for 15 hours to stand
on a playing field in the village of
bard field sailing mr-mrs do Old
MacDonald they've been at all their
general or local elections in recent
years despite often bitterly cold
weather and if he would spare a last
thought for the hapless voter from
Nottingham South who put his cross on a
ballot paper decided he'd cast it wrong
panicked and tried to eat it the
presiding officer forced him to disgorge
it and the poor man now faces
prosecution for wilfully damaging the
ballot paper not only is he not voted
right but he's going to get fined as
well if the police decide to prosecute
in this fish and chip shop in South
Bristol you cast your ballot next to the
batter and get a reward for your trouble
the west highland terrier received the
polling card his master didn't people
arriving at the only polling station at
Shepton Mallet in somerset found voting
meant first contributing to a boyscout
appeal fund that most didn't seem to
mind the electorate all four of them
cast their votes and then had a cup of
tea with a presiding officer here at
least labour polled 100% of the votes
